skshapelet.statistics package¶

Submodules¶

skshapelet.statistics.distance module¶

skshapelet.statistics.distance.euclidean_distance(this, other)[source]¶

Calculate the Euclidean distance between 2 1-D arrays.

Args:
this: ndarray

The array.

other: ndarray

The comparative array.

Returns:
output: float

The square of Euclidean distance.

skshapelet.statistics.distance.mahalanobis_distance(X, mean, inv_cov)[source]¶

Calculate the Mahalanobis distance between 2 1-D arrays.

Args:
X: ndarray

The comparative array.

mean: float

The mean of the array.

inv_cov:

Inverse covariance matrix related to the array.

Returns:
output: float

The square of Mahalanobis distance.

skshapelet.statistics.distance.zscore(a, axis=0, ddof=0)[source]¶

Calculate the z-score of 1-D array.

Args:
a: ndarray

The required array.

axis: int, optional

The axis of the array.

ddof: int, optional

Means Delta Degrees of Freedom.

Returns:
output: ndarray

The z-scores, standardized by mean and standard deviation of input array a.

skshapelet.statistics.early_abandon module¶

skshapelet.statistics.early_abandon.binary_information_gain(orderline, num_this_class, num_other_class, total_num_this_class, total_num_other_class, ig_threshold)[source]¶

Calculate the information gain. The idea is that we apply the KNN algorithm. We put the rest of class A to split left and put B to split right, respectively. However, we also need to switch again since we don’t know where class A belongs.

Args:
orderline: list

The list of distance with each time series.

num_this_class: int

The number of this class.

num_other_class:

The number of other classes.

total_num_this_class:

The total number of this class.

total_num_other_class:

The total number of other classes.

ig_threshold: float

The baseline of information gain.

Returns:
output: bool

Whether the current candidate should be rejected.

skshapelet.statistics.early_abandon.euclidean_distance(this_set, other_set, bsf_dist)[source]¶

Calculate the Euclidean distance between 2 1-D arrays. If the distance is larger than bsf_dist, then we end the calculation and return the bsf_dist.

Args:
this_set: ndarray

The array

other_set: ndarray

The comparative array.

bsf_dist:

The best so far distance.

Returns:
output: float

The accumulation of Euclidean distance.

skshapelet.statistics.early_abandon.mahalanobis_distance(X, mean, inv_cov, bsf_dist)[source]¶

Calculate the Mahalanobis distance between 2 1-D arrays. If the distance is larger than bsf_dist, then we end the calculation and return the bsf_dist.

Args:
X: ndarray

The comparative array.

mean: ndarray

The mean array of the array.

inv_cov:

Inverse covariance matrix related to the array.

bsf_dist:

The best so far distance.

Returns:
output: float

The accumulation of Mahalanobis distance.

skshapelet.statistics.entropy.entropy(*classes)[source]¶

Calculate the entropy.

Args:
classes: list

The list of the number of different classes.

Returns:
output: float

The entropy.

skshapelet.statistics.information_gain module¶

skshapelet.statistics.information_gain.binary_information_gain(orderline, total_num_this_class, total_num_other_class)[source]¶

Calculate the information gain.

Args:
orderline: list

The list of distance with each time series.

total_num_this_class:

The total number of this class.

total_num_other_class:

The total number of other classes.

Returns:
bsf_ig: float

The best so far information gain.
